name: Divine Damage Druid Dragon / Zen Archer (Druid 37 / Cleric 1 / Monk 2)
author: Orion

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
This was an idea I came up with this morning

Dragon shape with divine damage

Cleric 1 to get Divine Might (it gets turn undead with a single level)

Druid ranged weapons are a bit meh. Sling and Darts

Maybe done already, not sure. Will check when I get back from work. I probably should put knockdown in the build somewhere. AB is a problem so I didn't take monk or cleric pre-epic which is a bit annoying as the weapon foci  I need to take pre-epic, if I take them at all...

I could also drop INT further potentially it still has about 200+ skill points

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Thanks Web for your encouragement.
I liked my previous Druid build but it relied pretty heavily on resting etc etc which I didn't like, being able to shoot em with a bow effectively might minimise the resting...

Made an update to the build as described above. Got the Cha up to 20 which when capped at 32, will allow an 11 round Divine Might duration in zen archer form, bear, water elemental or dragon forum. 
I worried a little about the base AB of 36 but its only in archer form, and can be boosted by Owl's Insight, easily adding +6 to the value. Should be able to hit them at least a little.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Did a bit more tinkering

I figured with the high wisdom score from needing to get Dragon Shape, I may as well try to bump up cleric levels rather than just use a single level cleric cheese for Divine Might.

As a result its a stronger divine zen archer with divine power, divine favor (erm up to 18 casts of Divine Favor / extended Divine Favor), bless, aid, prayer, eagles splendor admittedly some of these goodies come late. Meta magic is good for extended and empowered. Cleric buffs unfortunately can be dispelled. It loses spell penetration and Mord resistance sadly. WoG players will love GMW and Darkfire for their crossbow and crossbow bolts. It gets crossbow attacks faster

With two divine spell books you can pretty much cast unlimited summons to tank piles of damage whilst you shoot em with divine damage crossbow damage, up to 5 attacks per round with DP and haste. If they dont have spell resistance throw in a few SoVs, Stone Holds and grease for disables as well

If you run out of spells, just turn into a dragon to finish em off

Anyway this is how it looks. Druid 9 spells with undispellability, Cleric 8 spells. Only space for monk cheese at level 40 sadly. Not sure about the domains. Maybe healing to synergise with druid heal spells. Or Strength for extra divine power casts. The level 39 feat could be anything you want, toughness is good, as is scribe scroll/craft wand, Maximise wouldn't be bad either, or silent/still spell for extra flexibility in spell management

I love how this build looks by the way. Its like a dual spell caster with buffed zen archery power, melee power (with Druid polymorphs) and a final topping of monk cheese at the end

Edit: made some adjustments to make it an elf with rapid shot. 

 Lots of modules will have bonus stuff for elven archers. Totally dumped cons with a pile of summons and the ability to polymorph it should be managable

Deities are little tough in WoG. Sehanine Moonbow (Travel/Trickery) unfortunately requires a chaotic good or chaotic neutral alignment, precluding monk. Bobcob provides Trickery which is probably the best domain for an archer. Rao provides Healing (empowered cures) and Law domains (for lesser mind blank). 

Dodged exp penalties for over two thirds of the build, 20% exp penalties between character levels 18-22 and 32-39, and 40% exp penalty from level 40 onwards.

Taking Fighter or Ranger as the last level would grant a bonus feat but Monk cheese is too good to ignore for the polymorphs...
